name: 277 North Campground
description: 17 sites each with a covered picnic table and a BBQ grill. The sites are suitable for tents or RVs. No drinking water or hookups available.
audioDescription: 17 sites each with a covered picnic table and a BBQ grill. The sites are suitable for tents or RVs. No drinking water or hookups available.
regulationsOverview: Groundfires are not permitted in the park. Each campsite has a grill.

fees.description: Overnight camping fee covers one campsite per night.
fees.title: Overnight Camping (Regula)

fees.description: Half price with Interagency Senior Pass or Access Pass.
fees.title: Overnight Camping (Discounted)

accessibility.fireStovePolicy: Ground fires are not permitted. Each campsite has a grill.
accessibility.adaInfo: The main road leading to the campground is paved but the road that goes to each campsite is not.

name: Akers Group Campground
description: Group campsites, located at Akers Ferry. The campground is located north of the junction of Highway KK and Highway K.
reservationInfo: Reservations may be made online at http://www.recreation.gov. If sites have not been reserved, they are available on a first-come-first-serve basis.
regulationsOverview: Laws and policies governing park campgrounds can be found in the Superintendent's Compendium on the park website.

fees.description: Summer group site fee from April 15 to October 15.
fees.title: Summer group site fee

operatingHours.description: Group campsites, located at Akers Ferry.  The campground is located at the junction of Highway KK and Highway K.
operatingHours.name: Akers Ferry

images.title: Akers
images.altText: Map showing campsites, restrooms, ranger station, roads and river
images.caption: Akers has group camp sites only.

images.title: Akers
images.altText: Map showing campsites, restrooms, ranger station, roads and river
images.caption: Akers has group camp sites only.

weatherOverview: Ozark National Scenic Riverways is located in southeast Missouri. Summer temperatures generally range from 75-100 degrees with high humidity. Winter temperatures generally range from 0-50 degrees with periods of intermittent freezing and snow.

accessibility.fireStovePolicy: Fires in designated fire rings only.
accessRoads: Unpaved Roads - All vehicles OK in good weather

name: Belle Fourche River Campground
description: *Loop B Bathroom Closed* The Belle Fourche River Campground is a 2-loop, 46-site campground with 4 accessible sites and 3 tent-only group sites. Drinking water is available at water spigots and in the restrooms. Large cottonwood trees provide shade. A picnic shelter and tables are available north of the campground. This is a first come, first served campground, no reservations. There is a 14-day limit on occupancy. There are 43 pull-through sites with room for RVs up to 35'. No hookups are available.
reservationInfo: No reservations are available for this campground. Occupation is on a first come, first served basis. There is a 14 day limit on occupancy. The campground will fill on some nights from June through September. There are typically sites available until 6:00 pm every day.
regulationsOverview: 1. Overnight stays/camping in park is only allowed in established sites within the Belle Fourche River Campground 2. Check-out is 12:00 pm 3. Maximum of 2 autos and 8 people per site; 4 vehicles and 20 people for group sites. 4. Quiet hours from 10:00 pm to 6:00 am; idling of motor vehicles is prohibited during quiet hours 5. Generators permitted from 8 am to 8 pm 6. Campsite occupancy may not exceed 14 cumulative days within a 28-day period 7. Collection of firewood is prohibited within the park 8. No attaching or tying items to trees 9. Pets must be leashed at all times and may not be left unattended

fees.description: Individual sites can accommodate up to 8 people. A maximum of two vehicles (or 4 motorcycles) are permitted at each site. The nearby picnic area may be used for overflow parking.
fees.title: Individual Sites

fees.description: Group sites can accommodate up to 20 people per site. A maximum of 4 autos is permitted at each site. The nearby picnic area may be used for overflow parking if necessary.
fees.title: Group Sites

fees.description:
Accessible sites are: A2, A4, B11 and B25. 
Individual sites can accommodate up to 8 people. A maximum of two vehicles (or 4 motorcycles) are permitted at each site. The nearby picnic area may be used for overflow parking.
fees.title: Accessible Sites

directionsOverview: From the entrance station, travel along the park road approximately 1 mile, and turn left at the Administration Building. Stay left at the fork, and the campground is at the end of the road.

operatingHours.description: The Belle Fourche Campground will be open for the season May 15 - October 17 (closed by noon on 10/17)
operatingHours.name: Belle Fourche River Campground

images.title: The Belle Fourche Campground
images.altText: A peaceful, quiet campground with tents, fire grates and picnic benches.
images.caption: The Belle Fourche Campground

images.title: Campground in Fall
images.altText: Campground with Devils Tower in the background
images.caption: September is a beautiful time to camp at Devils Tower National Monument!

images.title: Group Site
images.altText: Several tents set up in a group site
images.caption: The three group sites are great for large gatherings

images.title: Campground Map
images.altText: A map of the campground area
images.caption: The campground is separated into two loops, with basic services available throughout.

weatherOverview: Obtain forecast information before beginning your adventures and observe changing weather conditions. Thunderstorms can develop quickly bringing lightening, hail, rain, and hypothermia. Summer days can bring very hot temperatures. Carry enough water, and realize the area around the Tower can reach over 100 degrees Fahrenheit.

accessibility.wheelchairAccess: Wheelchairs should be able to navigate around the campground, picnic and amphitheater areas with little difficulty. Be aware that the roads are paved but most areas have gravel parking with grass and dirt camping areas, except the accessible sites which have cement areas and a raised platform for tents.
accessibility.fireStovePolicy: Fires are permitted only in the designated fire rings, and only as long as there are no fire restrictions or dangerous fire weather
accessibility.rvInfo: The 46 sites include pull-thrus with room for RVs up to 35', No hookups available. Long vehicles and vehicles with trailers are recommended to use B Loop.
accessibility.adaInfo: Four sites in the campground are accessible - sites A-2, A-4, B-11, and B-25. Campground restrooms are accessible. The outdoor amphitheater is wheelchair accessible. The picnic area restrooms and drinking fountain are accessible. Two picnic tables will accommodate wheelchairs. They are located on either side of the sidewalk before you reach the restrooms.
